segments.content:
* **React**: A good mix of content and many community articles, but no major announcements.
* **React Native**: The 2024 survey results are out, infra libraries now support RN 0.78, and Nitro Views have been released!
* **Other**: Several TC39 proposals are progressingâ€”my favorites are `import defer` and `RegExp.escape()`.

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [AI coding benchmarks for backends](https://convex.link/thisweekbench)
* ğŸ‘€ [React Explorer - Turns your React site into an interactive visualization](https://www.react-explorer.com/)
* ğŸ“– [Deno docs - Build an app with TanStack and Deno](https://docs.deno.com/examples/tanstack_tutorial/)
* ğŸ—“ [React-Summit](https://reactsummit.com/?utm_source=Newsletter\&utm_medium=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡± Amsterdam - 13 & 17 June. CFP is closing soon on March 2! Last chance to submit your talks for a top-tier tech audience.
* ğŸ“œ [How Preply improved INP on a Next.js application (without React Server Components and App Router)](https://medium.com/preply-engineering/how-preply-improved-inp-on-a-next-js-application-without-react-server-components-and-app-router-491713149875): A deep dive into this Core Web Vital metrics and various things Preply tried to improve it, using a data-driven approach.
* ğŸ“œ [Avoiding Server Component Waterfall Fetching with React 19 cache()](https://aurorascharff.no/posts/avoiding-server-component-waterfall-fetching-with-react-19-cache/): You can use `React.cache()` to deduplicate requests and preload data as soon as possible to avoid request waterfalls. This works but creates an implicit coupling. Iâ€™d prefer a more explicit model, hoisting all requests and passing promises down as props.
* ğŸ“œ [Armin's TanStack Router Notes](https://gist.github.com/mitsuhiko/555b45f020a8d7e389516b51f6d03534): Documents challenges encountered while trying to determine whether Sentry could adopt TanStack Router.
* ğŸ“œ [Thereâ€™s no such thing as an isomorphic layout effect](https://smoores.dev/post/no_such_thing_isomorphic_layout_effect/): A possible interpretation of the story behind the `useIsomorphicLayoutEffect` pattern.
* ğŸ“œ [Debouncing in React Router v7](https://programmingarehard.com/2025/02/24/debouncing-in-react-router-v7.html/): Interesting technique relying on `clientLoader`
* ğŸ“œ [How to Download a file from a React Router route](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/download-a-file-from-a-react-router-route): With/without dynamic params, with/without JS.
* ğŸ“œ [Shadcn Registry: A Better Way to Manage Your UI Components](https://ouassim.tech/notes/shadcn-registry-a-better-way-to-manage-your-ui-components/)
* ğŸ“œ [Throwing vs. Returning Redirects in React Router](https://sergiodxa.com/articles/throwing-vs-returning-redirects-in-react-router)
* ğŸ“œ [Functional programming in React](https://www.56kode.com/posts/level-up-react-functional-programming-in-react/)
* ğŸ“œ [React Performance: Common Problems & Their Solutions](https://blog.sentry.io/react-js-performance-guide/)
* ğŸ“œ [Making Next.js Apps Faster: A Practical Performance Guide Beyond Next.js](https://tigerabrodi.blog/making-nextjs-apps-faster-a-practical-performance-guide-beyond-nextjs)
* ğŸ“œ [Progressive forms with server actions](https://waku.gg/blog/progressive-forms)
* ğŸ“¦ [Create TanStack Router App 0.4 - Add-ons, SolidJS support, MCP support](https://github.com/TanStack/create-tsrouter-app/releases/tag/v0.4.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Scan 0.2 - Slowdown notifications, explanations and pre-generated prompts to fix them](https://github.com/aidenybai/react-scan/releases/tag/v0.2.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Scan Chrome Extension](https://github.com/jantimon/chrome-react-scan-inspector)
* ğŸ“¦ [Storybook 8.6 - Storybook Test improvements](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/releases/tag/v8.6.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Admin 5.6 - Black & white theme](https://github.com/marmelab/react-admin/releases/tag/v5.6.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [Bun 1.2.3 - Built-in React support with hot-reloading, React init template](https://bun.sh/blog/bun-v1.2.3)
* ğŸ”¨ [Laravel Starter Kits](https://laravel.com/starter-kits): Include a new official React 19 + Inertia 2 starter kit.
* ğŸ”¨ [Remix Epic Stack update - Passkeys, Helmets, and more!](https://github.com/epicweb-dev/epic-stack/discussions/937)
* ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington - Fix Your Slow React App With React-Scan](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3EnathFYgz8)
* ğŸ¥ [Syntax - Should You Use Signals with React?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Diy4XRSFTiA)
* ğŸ¥ [Cosden - Combining React Query With Server Components (Next.js)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XcUpTPbY4Wg)

segments.content: Meticulous creates and maintains an exhaustive suite of e2e ui tests with **zero** developer effort.
segments.sourceMdx: Meticulous creates and maintains an exhaustive suite of e2e ui tests with **zero** developer effort.Â

segments.content: Dropbox, Bilt Rewards, Lattice and hundreds of engineeringÂ organizations rely on Meticulous for their frontend testing.
segments.sourceMdx: Dropbox, Bilt Rewards, Lattice and hundreds of engineeringÂ organizations rely on Meticulous for their frontend testing.

segments.content: This quote from the CTO of Traba sums the productÂ up best: "Meticulous has fundamentally changed the way we approach frontend testing in our web applications, fully eliminating the need to write any frontend tests. The software gives us confidence that every change will be completely regression tested, allowing us to ship more quickly with significantly fewer bugs in our code."
segments.sourceMdx: This quote from the CTO of Traba sums the productÂ up best: "Meticulous has fundamentally changed the way we approach frontend testing in our web applications, fully eliminating the need to write any frontend tests. The software gives us confidence that every change will be completely regression tested, allowing us to ship more quickly with significantly fewer bugs in our code."

segments.content: This [post](https://www.meticulous.ai/blog/lessons-from-a-decade?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_campaign=jan15th)Â from our CTO, who formerly led a large engineering group at Palantir, sets out the context of why exhaustive testing can double engineering velocity.
segments.sourceMdx: This [post](https://www.meticulous.ai/blog/lessons-from-a-decade?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_campaign=jan15th)Â from our CTO, who formerly led a large engineering group at Palantir, sets out the context of why exhaustive testing can double engineering velocity.

segments.content: The survey results are out and Iâ€™m super proud that among all the React Native resources, this newsletter got the highest positivity score. Thank you â¤ï¸!
segments.sourceMdx: The survey results are out and Iâ€™m super proud that among all the React Native resources, this newsletter got the highest positivity score. Thank you â¤ï¸!

segments.content: I canâ€™t summarize the whole survey, but here are a few things I discovered:
segments.sourceMdx: I canâ€™t summarize the whole survey, but here are a few things I discovered:

segments.content:
* 61% of RN devs came from React (web)
* iOS and Android remain the most common RN targets, but the Web also has a 22% market share
* Libraries with the most positive sentiment are: Reanimated, TanStack Query, Zustand, React Navigation, Expo Router, Skia.
* No clear winner in terms of styling. Devs like the built-in APIs such as StyleSheet and inline styles.
segments.sourceMdx:
- 61% of RN devs came from React (web)
- iOS and Android remain the most common RN targets, but the Web also has a 22% market share
- Libraries with the most positive sentiment are: Reanimated, TanStack Query, Zustand, React Navigation, Expo Router, Skia.
- No clear winner in terms of styling. Devs like the built-in APIs such as StyleSheet and inline styles.

segments.content:
* ğŸ‘€ [Chromium - Intent to ship Observables API in Chrome 135](https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/stxSgTgMHog)
* ğŸ® [Anchoreum - A game for learning CSS Anchor Positioning](https://anchoreum.com/): I didnâ€™t expect Anchor Positioning to be as powerful. Itâ€™s in Interop 2025 and likely to land in all browsers this year, so now is a great time to learn!
* ğŸ“œ [TC39 Advances 3 Proposals to Stage 4: RegExp Escaping, Float16Array, and Redeclarable global eval vars](https://socket.dev/blog/tc39-advances-3-proposals-to-stage-4-regexp-escaping-float16array-and-redeclarable-global-eval)
* ğŸ“œ [Extreme Server-Side Rendering](https://www.scd31.com/posts/extreme-server-side-rendering): Keeping the connection alive, a server can stream updates continuously to the client. The author implemented a Flappy Bird game relying on this technique, without any JS.
* ğŸ“œ [Testing Web Authentication (WebAuthn)](https://www.heal.dev/docs/blog/testing-webauthn): TIL you can leverage Chrome DevTools features in Playwright.
* ğŸ“œ [Speeding up the JavaScript ecosystem - Rust and JavaScript Plugins](https://marvinh.dev/blog/speeding-up-javascript-ecosystem-part-11/)
* ğŸ“œ [A Million Little Secrets - Deconstructing the â€œWhimsical Animationsâ€ landing page](https://www.joshwcomeau.com/blog/whimsical-animations/)
* ğŸ“œ [Subverting control with weak references](https://jlongster.com/subverting-control-weak-refs)
* ğŸ¥ [TypeScript types can run DOOM](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0mCsluv5FXA): Just ğŸ¤¯.
